com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface DisplayArea

public interface DisplayArea

A DisplayArea is a portion of a Display corresponding with a particular area of interest (map area) that can be rendered upon. A Display Manager sends a DisplayArea to a Layer's draw() method for rendering.

Method Summary
 void clear()
          Clears the DisplayArea by painting it with the background color.
 void dispose()
          Disposed any resources at end of use.
 Envelope getArea()
          Returns the map area that is to be drawn upon.
 Color getBackground()
          Returns the current background color of the Display.
 CoordinateSystem getCoordinateSystem()
          get the coordinate system
 Envelope getExtent()
          Returns the extent of the map area.
 Graphics2D getGraphics()
          Returns a graphics context, so you can render onto the Display.
 Transform getInverseTransform()
          Returns the current screen-to-world coordinates transformation.
 Dimension getSize()
          Returns the pixel size corresponding with the Extent.
 Transform getTransform()
          Returns the current world-to-screen coordinates transformation.

getGraphics

Returns a graphics context, so you can render onto the Display.

getTransform

public Transform getTransform()
Returns the current world-to-screen coordinates transformation. This transform will convert from world units to screen units.

Returns:
the transform
See Also:
getInverseTransform()

getInverseTransform

public Transform getInverseTransform()
Returns the current screen-to-world coordinates transformation. This transform will convert from screen units to world units. The scale of this transform is commonly refered to as the "map scale" (map unts per pixel).

Returns:
the inverse transform

clear

public void clear()
Clears the DisplayArea by painting it with the background color.

public void dispose()
Disposed any resources at end of use.

getCoordinateSystem

public CoordinateSystem getCoordinateSystem()
get the coordinate system

Returns:
the map coordinate system
